Ludus (ancient Rome) In ancient Roman culture, the Latin word ludus (plural "ludi") has several meanings within the semantic field of "play, game, sport, training" (see also ludic). An elementary or primary school or the school of the “litterator" attended by boys and girls up to the age of 11 was a "ludus". "Ludi" were to be found throughout the city, and were run by a "ludi magister" (schoolmaster) who was often an educated slave or freedman.
